item.title: Taiwan Trip, June 2019, (Part 2 of 2)
item.description: Have you read Part 1? Day 3 We ate breakfast in McDo, the one near the place we stayed in, and it didnâ€™t serve any local variant of Taiwan's food. It's all hamburgers, fried chicken, and sausage McNothinâ€™. Some would say that eating at a known (read: exploitive capitalist) fast food chain, one that you also have in your country, is a disservice to the self to get to know the locals or their food, but that wasnâ€™t our case.
